==Events==
* [[538]] &ndash; [[Vitiges]], [[Germanic king|king]] of the [[Ostrogoths]] ends his [[Siege of Rome (537–538)|siege]] of [[Rome]] and retreats to [[Ravenna]], leaving the city in the hands of the victorious [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] general, [[Belisarius]].
*[[1550]] &ndash; Several hundred [[Spanish Empire|Spanish]] and indigenous troops under the command of [[Pedro de Valdivia]] defeat an army of 60,000 [[Mapuche]] at the [[Battle of Penco]] during the [[Arauco War]] in present-day [[Chile]].
*[[1622]] &ndash; [[Ignatius of Loyola]] and [[Francis Xavier]], founders of the Jesuits, are canonized as saints by the Catholic Church.
*[[1689]] &ndash; The [[Williamite War in Ireland]] begins.
*[[1811]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: A day after a successful [[rear guard]] action, [[Marshal of France|French Marshal]] [[Michel Ney]] once again successfully delayed the pursuing Anglo-Portuguese force at the [[Battle of Redinha]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Red River Campaign]] begins as a US Navy fleet of 13 Ironclads and 7 Gunboats and other support ships enter the Red River.
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Henry James O'Farrell|Henry O'Farrell]] attempts to assassinate [[Alfred, Duke of Saxe-Coburg and Gotha|Prince Alfred, Duke of Edinburgh]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; [[Andrew Watson (footballer)|Andrew Watson]] makes his [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] debut as the world's first [[black people|black]] international [[association football|football]] player and [[Captain (association football)|captain]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Tonkin Campaign]]: [[French Third Republic|France]] [[Bắc Ninh Campaign|captures]] the citadel of [[Bắc Ninh]].
*[[1894]] &ndash; [[Coca-Cola]] is bottled and sold for the first time in [[Vicksburg, Mississippi]], by local soda fountain operator Joseph Biedenharn.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Greek cruiser Georgios Averof]] is launched at [[Livorno]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The [[Girl Guide and Girl Scout|Girl Guides]] (later renamed the [[Girl Scouts of the USA]]) are founded in the [[United States]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Canberra Day]]: The future capital of [[Australia]] is officially named [[Canberra]]. ([[Melbourne]] remains temporary capital until [[1927]] while the new capital is still under construction.)
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Moscow]] becomes the capital of [[Russia]] again after [[Saint Petersburg]] held this status for 215 years.
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[İstiklal Marşı]] was adopted in [[TBMM]](Turkish grand national assembly).
*[[1922]] &ndash; Armenia, Georgia and Azerbaijan formed The [[Transcaucasian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic]]
*[[1928]] &ndash; In [[California]], the [[St. Francis Dam]] fails; the resulting floods kill over 600 people.
*[[1930]] &ndash; [[Mahatma Gandhi]] leads a 200-mile march, known as the ''[[Salt Satyagraha|Salt March]]'', to the sea in defiance of [[United Kingdom|British]] opposition, to protest the [[British Empire|British]] monopoly on salt
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[Great Depression]]: [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] addresses the nation for the first time as [[President of the United States]]. This is also the first of his "[[fireside chats]]".
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Konstantin Päts]] and General [[Johan Laidoner]] stage a coup in [[Estonia]], and ban all political parties.
*[[1938]] &ndash; ''[[Anschluss]]:'' [[Nazi Germany|German]] troops occupy [[Austria]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Winter War]]: [[Finland]] signs the [[Moscow Peace Treaty (1940)|Moscow Peace Treaty]] with the [[Soviet Union]], ceding almost all of [[Finnish Karelia]]. Finnish troops and the remaining population are immediately evacuated.
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[Truman Doctrine]] is proclaimed to help stem the spread of [[Communism]].
*[[1950]] &ndash; The [[Llandow air disaster]] occurs near [[Sigingstone]], [[Wales]], in which 80 people die when their aircraft crashed, making it the world's deadliest air disaster at the time.
*[[1961]] &ndash; First Winter Ascent of the [[Eiger_north_face#1960s|Eiger north face]].
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Suharto]] takes over from [[Sukarno]] to become [[List of Presidents of Indonesia|Acting President]] of [[Indonesia]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Mauritius]] achieves independence from the United Kingdom.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[1971 Turkish coup d'état|The March 12 Memorandum]] is sent to the [[Demirel]] government of Turkey and the government resigns.
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Mauritius]] becomes a [[republic]] while remaining a member of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; Several [[1993 Mumbai bombings|bombs explode]] in [[Bombay]] (Mumbai), [[India]], killing about 300 and injuring hundreds more.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[North Korea nuclear weapons program]]: [[North Korea]] says that it plans to withdraw from the [[Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty]] and refuses to allow inspectors access to its nuclear sites.
*[[1993]]   &ndash; The [[Blizzard of 1993]] &ndash; Snow begins to fall across the eastern portion of the US with tornadoes, thunder snow storms, high winds and record low temperatures. The storm lasts for 30&nbsp;hours.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Janet Reno]] was sworn in as the [[United States]]' first female attorney general.
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[Church of England]] ordains its first female priests.
*[[1999]] &ndash; Former [[Warsaw Pact]] members the [[Czech Republic]], [[Hungary]] and [[Poland]] join [[NATO]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Zoran Đinđić]], [[Prime Minister]] of [[Serbia]], is [[Assassination of Zoran Đinđić|assassinated]] in [[Belgrade]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[President of South Korea]], [[Roh Moo-hyun]], is impeached by its [[National Assembly of South Korea|National Assembly]]: the first such impeachment in the nation's history.
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Karolos Papoulias]] becomes [[President of Greece]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; Financier [[Bernard Madoff]] pleads guilty in New York to scamming $18 billion, the largest in Wall Street history.
*[[2011]] &ndash; A reactor at the [[Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant]] melts and explodes and releases radioactivity into the atmosphere a day after Japan's [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami|earthquake]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; An [[2014 East Harlem apartment buildings explosion|explosion]] in the [[New York City]] neighborhood of [[East Harlem]] kills 8 and injures 70 others.
